metadata.titel_preek: The Trinity in the Last Ditch

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Triune God pursues and sustains rebellious and failing humanity through self-giving love that refuses to let go, even in the 'last ditch' of human failure.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, and Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
the Someone who... pursues us even beyond the grave
the love that persists in breaking through our resistance

object.identificatie: The restoration and presence of God with the beloved (the Church/the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: bring the Corinthian church back into the fold

zender.identificatie: The Inner Nature of the Trinity (Self-giving Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'ungrateful and unresponsive' (Corinthians and the modern Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: the church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver of a love they did not earn.

helper.identificatie: The Apostle Paul / Human 'hints' of love (parents, teachers)
tekstueel_bewijs: Paul... is with them to the last ditch
That person has conveyed to you a measure of the love of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; human helpers are icons of His action.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that binds the Subject to the Receiver.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human resistance, spiritual arrogance, and the 'Last Ditch' (Death/Sin)
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but 'the grave' and 'hell' (Psalm 139), requiring Resurrection power.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Apostle Paul's struggle to reclaim the Corinthian church.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Paul
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Paul's agony is presented as a finite participation in/reflection of the Trinity's infinite agony for the lost.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Trinitarian Love → Grace/Presence → The Failing Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Paul/Human Love → The Triune God ← Sin/Death/Resistance

voorbeelden_god_subject: the love that upholds the universe

voorbeelden: Examine yourselves... Mend your ways (cited as 'barking orders' and 'problematic')
He will not let them go
we are ready to see that Paul was not being perfunctory
lives by the power of God
the love that persists in breaking through

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to save over the human 'obligation' (Devoir) to perform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Last Ditch' (S2) and 'Mending ways' (~S1) to the realization of God's inescapable presence (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God occupies the 'Last Ditch' (S2) so that it becomes the site of Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'last ditch' and 'hell' are treated as real threats that only God can navigate.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly deconstructs moralistic imperatives ('Mend your ways') as 'problematic' and 'death,' replacing them with the ontological reality of God's character.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the love that persists in breaking through our resistance
It is not dependent on the worthiness of the other

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is not an example to follow, but a 'fool' whose agony mirrors God's.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Paul's weakness is the conduit for God's power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' rather than 'burden of duty'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: God does the work of holding the relationship together.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrates the human analogy (parent) with the biblical narrative (Paul) and the dogmatic reality (Trinity).
spanning_punten: The tension between Paul's 'barking orders' and his 'apostolic devotion'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: conformed to Christ, his crucified Lord

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that provides the 'Pouvoir' (power) to be with God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, Grace is the Object, and the Hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a Trinity Sunday sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (the Last Ditch/Death) is sufficiently grave.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's love) precedes and enables the Secondary Program (Paul's ministry).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism Trap' by making Paul's struggle a window into God's character rather than a checklist for the hearer's behavior.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'parent' metaphor's pathos, Greimas shows how that metaphor functions to switch the Subject from 'Me' to 'God'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 2 Cor 13; Greimasian analysis reveals that the sermon's 'engine' is the Trinitarian nature itself.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'commands' in the text are actantially subordinated to God's 'Pouvoir-faire'.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'.
